review: The initial setup stopped when the "scanning for network" came on the screen and then nothing else happened. I went through tech support (very nice, quick response) and wasn't able to get past that part of setup. I know my wireless network works and the box was close to the router and not in a cabinet per the online help/troubleshooting information. They sent me a new box overnight. Same problem.Here is the cause and solution: My SSID (network name) is hidden and there are no other networks close enough for the Fire TV box to pickup, so it couldn't progress to the screen for manually entering wireless information. Once I used an Ethernet cable to connect the box to the network everything started working. I unplugged the Fire TV box, relocated it to the television I wanted to pair it with, and then did entered the wireless network information.I like the voice search feature. There are fewer games than I hoped for, but more apps than I thought there would be. Overall I am pleased with it.
